writing_prompt: While searching through your partner's bag for a pen, you stumble upon a wooden stake and an old prom photo, uncovering a past filled with vampire slaying, werewolf boyfriends, and secrets you never expected.
story:
“Willow, do you have any pens?” Pansy found a new fascination for pens when Willow showed them to her.
“I might have one in my bag. You can check it out.” Willow waved towards her large purse.
“Sweet.” Pansy grabbed the bag and pulled it onto her lap. “I have to believe there’s one in here.”
Pansy unzipped it and started to rifle through it. “What the heck?” She pulled out a wooden stick. “What is this?”
“Oh, it’s a stake from when I used to help Buffy. I always had one on me in case of an emergency.” Willow took it and twirled it between her fingers. “I forgot it was in there.”
“Right.” Pansy resumed her search for a pen. She noticed there was a photo and pulled it out. “Bloody Hell, you look so young.”
“What?” Willow looked confused until Pansy gave it to her. “OH!”
“Where are you?” Pansy looked over her shoulder.
“It’s my Prom during my Senior year.” Willow nodded.
“Prom?” Pansy sounded confused. “I don’t know what that is?”
“You don’t have dances?” Willow appeared surprised.
“Well, yeah, but by the time it was my final year, we were thick in a war, so no dances.” Pansy shook her head.
“Aw…you would have had fun.” Willow smiled. “I went with Oz here.” She pointed to the short guy next to her. “He was a werewolf, but he left shortly after to get better control of his wolf side.”
“He never attacked you?” Pansy’s eyebrow arched.
“No, he would stay in a special cage for him,” Willow explained.
“Oh, nice. I don’t see Faith.” Pansy pointed out.
“Faith.” Willow sighed. “She was in a troublesome mood at the time, plus she didn’t go to our school when she met us. She just came to the Library to meet with her Watcher.”
Pansy nodded. “Ah. Which one is Buffy?”
“This one.” Willow showed her.
“She’s short.” Pansy wasn’t expecting Buffy to be shorter than Willow.
“She is, but she has a powerful body,” Willow smirked. “Plus, she was in love with a vampire.”
“What?” Pansy pulled away. “Are you joshing me?”
“No, really. She was in love with Angel.” Willow bobbled her head.
“Anyways, when did you start dating women?” Pansy was curious.
“College.” Willow exhaled.
“Do you miss your friends?” Pansy pointed to the Prom picture.
“Yes and no.” Willow shook her head. “I miss their companionship, but I don’t miss the patrols at all. I’ll go with Faith if she ever asks, but she won’t.”
“She won’t?” Pansy’s voice had a shocked tone.
“No, she prefers to go alone.” Willow shrugged. “Can we talk about something else?”
Pansy dug down to the bottom of Willow’s bag, felt something slim and pulled it out. “AHA!”
“Yeah!” Willow put her stake and picture back into the bag. “Remind me to call them later.”
“Sure thing, darling.” Pansy kissed her before putting her purse back where it was.
When Pansy turned back towards her, Willow cupped her face and started kissing her deeply. She moaned into Willow’s mouth, wrapping her arms around her.
Willow leaned into her and forced Pansy to lean back onto the couch arm. “Gosh, I love you, Pans.”
“I love you, too, Willow.” Pansy tightened her arms and popped them into their bedroom for some afternoon delight. The pen laid on the floor, forgotten.

writing_prompt: When Hermione's partners, Ginny and Luna, propose an unconventional plan to start a family with the help of Harry and Draco, the group must navigate the complexities of love, friendship, and the magic of creating something new together.
story:
Hermione came home late one night, exhausted from work. “Ginny? Luna?”
“In here, love,” Ginny yelled out.
Hermione followed the voices to the den and found Harry and Draco were visiting. “Hello, Harry, Draco.”
“Hermione!” Harry gave her a tight hug, followed by Draco.
“What do we owe the pleasure of your visit?” Hermione sat down between Luna and Ginny to receive kisses from them. “Thank you, my loves.”
“Well, we all have been talking, and we need your opinion.” Draco appeared nervous.
Hermione’s eyebrows furrow, “Oh?”
“Hermione, my lion, look at me, please.” Luna caressed her cheek.
Hermione gazed into Luna’s silvery grey eyes. “Yes?”
“Ginny wants to expand our family, and we know that it hurts you that you can’t carry a child after Dolohov’s curse.” Everyone shivered at his name. “Ginny and I asked the boys here to see if they would give their sperm.”
Hermione’s eyes widened at the first part - and she glanced over at the boys to see them nodding. “Really? You would do this?”
“Yes. Hermione, we have been best friends since our first year. There isn’t anything I wouldn’t do for you.” Harry knelt in front of her. “Draco and I talked this over and over, and we decided that we would do this if you three were willing to help us become fathers at least once.”
Hermione started to cry. Her lovers wrapped their arms around her to comfort her. “Are you serious about this, Ginny? What about your Quidditch career?”
“It’s fun, but it’s hard on the body. I have talked to Daily Prophet, and they are hiring me to cover Quidditch instead.” Ginny smiled at her lover.
“Hermione, you are our breadwinner at the Ministry. It’s time that you have something to show for it and to pass on your knowledge to the next generation.” Luna whispered.
“Merlin, I love you both.” Hermione kissed them both hard. “Have you figured out who is doing who?”
“Hermione!” Draco made a face, cracking her up. “Don’t be crass.”
Hermione snickered. “Sorry.”
“It’s going to be Draco with Luna, Ginny and me,” Harry replied as he rubbed Draco’s arms. “We will figure out our mixing later. We aren’t in a hurry.”
Hermione took a deep breath. “Okay, you two don’t have an issue with it?” She glanced at Ginny and Luna.
“No, and Draco?” Ginny gazed at him, “I would love to mother your child, just to mess with your Father.”
All five of them started to laugh out loud. “Okay, Ginny. It would be funny if you had a redhead with my looks.”
“Exactly,” Ginny smirked cheekily.
Hermione just squealed happily. “We are going to have a family!”
Luna and Ginny smiled at her, “Yes, my lion.”
“Yes, my darling, and we made an appointment for the end of the week at St. Mungo’s to start the process for both of us since we don’t know if it will work the first time.”
“Brilliant.” Hermione jumped and pulled Harry and Draco up. “Thank you.” She gave them a hug that rivalled Mrs. Weasley’s.
“Hermione, I can’t breathe.” Harry gasped.
“Oh, sorry.” She let them go immediately. “Seriously, thank you. I honestly didn’t think I would have a family since my fifth year.”
“You are welcome, Hermione.” Harry smiled. “You always were the one who stuck with me.”
Hermione hugged him again, and the other smiled at the two friends. Hermione’s stomach started to growl.
“We need to feed you.” Luna gently steered her into the dining room, where the table was set for her. “Come, eat.” Luna pushed Hermione into her seat. “I have your favourite warming in the oven.”
“Shepherd’s pie?” Hermione perked up as everyone else sat down.
“Yes, here you go, my lion.” Luna served her dinner as she slipped into her chair. “We are going to chat with you while you eat.”
“Honestly, this is your best yet, my moon.” Hermione hummed at the meal.
“Thank you.” Luna smiled at her before turning to Harry, “What’s new in the Auror’s office?”
The rest of the night was pleasant, with discussions about work and their hobbies while Hermione relaxed.

writing_prompt: As Lionel boards the Hogwarts Express on his birthday, clutching his new black cat named Panther, he wonders what surprises await him at school—and which house will become his new home.
story:
Fleur, Hermione, and Luna are ushering their two children through the wall to get them on the train to Hogwarts. Victoire had been there two years already. Now it’s Lionel’s turn, and he isn’t happy about it.
“Mum?” He looked up at Luna.
“Yes, my little lion,” Luna smiled down at him.
“Must I go today of all days?” Lionel grumbled.
“Lionel Forrest Granger.” Hermione sharply got his attention. “I understand that you don’t want to go on your birthday, but.” Hermione ruffled his hair. “You are going to have one of the best feasts for your birthday.”
“I am?” Lionel looked at his sister.
“Didn’t I send you letters about all the good food that I get to eat, little brother?” Victoire wrapped her arm around his neck. “I promise you, you will love it.”
“What about my surprise?” Lionel looked up.
Fleur smirked at her wives and went to Harry to get something special. “Merci, Harry.”
“No problem. Tell him Happy Birthday.” Harry smiled.
“I shall,” Fleur grinned as she walked back to her little family. “Here you go, my little lion.”
Lionel got excited to see a birdcage, but when he pulled the cover off. There wasn’t a bird in it.
“KITTY!” Lionel clapped his hands. “Thank you, Mum, Mama, Maman.” He gave them all hugs and kisses. He took the black cat out of the cage and held him to his chest. “Can you make that a proper cage for him?”
“Certainly, my little one.” Hermione flicked her wand, and the cage turned into a cat carrier. “What are you going to name it?”
“Panther.”
“Excellent name for the cat.” Luna smiled as the train whistle blew. “We better get you two on the train.”
Fleur and Hermione helped Victoire and Lionel get their trunks on the train along with their familiars’ cages.
“Get on the train.” Luna ushered them on. “Lionel, please send us a message to tell us which house you are in.”
“Will Vic let me use her owl?” Lionel looked back at his sister.
“Of course, and turn around. There is one more surprise.” Victoire nudged him.
Lionel turned around to find their parents standing there with a large box. “What’s that?”
“It’s something that we whipped on for you two to eat on the way. It’s a long ride.” Luna gave it to her son.
Lionel looked in the box and was happy to see both their favourite treats. “Thanks, Mum!”
The train whistle blew again just as it started to move.
“Have fun,” Luna yelled.
“Don’t forget to study!” Hermione shouted, causing them to roll their eyes.
“And stay out of trouble.” Fleur gave them a bright smile.
“We love you!” Luna chimed.
“We love you, too, Maman, Mama, Mum!” Victoire and Lionel yelled as they started to disappear.
“It’s going to feel weird with no kids in the house,” Hermione remarked.
“Yes, but just think of all the fun we can have without worrying about scarring them,” Fleur smirked.
“Oh, or have fun in all the rooms again, minus their rooms.” Luna bounced as the other two nodded.
“Hey, Hermione, Luna and Fleur!” Harry and Ginny came over.
“Hey, Harry and Ginny.” Luna hugged them. “Thank you for holding that for us.”
“Of course. Did Lion name it?” Harry asked.
“Yes, Panther.” Hermione shook her head.
“That’s perfect.” Ginny smiled. “Do you want to join us for some lunch somewhere?”
Fleur looked at her wives and saw their agreement. “Oui. Let’s go into muggle London.”
“Sounds good to us.” Harry wrapped his arm around Ginny before following them out of the station. They found a local pub and chatted about old times and the interesting train rides to Fleur’s amusement

writing_prompt: Years after the war, Severus Snape stumbles upon an art exhibit dedicated entirely to him, only to discover Hermione Granger is the artist—and she has a shocking secret to share.
story:
Severus walked into a museum near his house in Seville, Spain. He was shocked to see a full art display depicting him: sketches, statues and paintings. “What the bloody hell?” He narrowed his eyes on the signature on the sketch in front of him. “Hermione Granger?”
“Yes?” A voice that he hadn’t heard in years.
Severus whipped around, “You!” She gasped before she fainted. “Merlin, she’s dramatic.” He picked her up and walked over to the proprietor, “May I use your office?”
The older gentleman’s eyes widened to see the artist passed out. “Yes, please go ahead.”
“Thank you.” Severus strolled into the manager’s office and flicked his wrist to keep the muggles away. He laid Hermione down on the divan in the office. “Miss Granger.”
Hermione’s eyes fluttered open. “It’s really you.”
“Yes, It’s me. What are you on about?” Severus sat down in a chair.
“I wasn’t expecting to see you alive.” Hermione slowly sat up on the couch. “Everyone thinks you’re dead.”
“Good,” Severus replied. “I have no reason to be alive.”
“Not even for a son?” Hermione whispered.
“What?” Severus’s face showed shock. “I don’t have a son.”
“Yes, you do, and his name is Septimus Severus.” Hermione sniffed, “And he’s our son.”
“Don’t tell me he’s a Granger.” Severus gave her a furious glare.
“No.” Hermione shook her head. “I gave him the Prince last name since I had a feeling that you didn’t like your Snape one from your potions book.”
“That blasted book.” Severus spat. “But thank you for telling me. Explain something to me.”
“I’ll try to, Severus.” Hermione leaned forward.
“What is all that?” Severus pointed to the door.
Hermione sighed. “Our son was asking about you, and I also needed an outlet for my frustrations with the magical world.”
“You better not have taken it out on him.” Severus sneered.
“Don’t be ridiculous.” Hermione snapped back. “Harry was the only one who understood and helped me fend off the vultures.”
“Mum, MUM!” Septimus ran into the office and pulled up short upon seeing his father. “Father?”
Severus couldn’t believe his eyes when he saw a spitting image of himself enter the room. He whipped his head towards Hermione. “How did you manage the scrutiny?”
“By living in the muggle world.” Hermione sighed. “Our son convinced me to put on a show of my work, and here we are.”
“It’s beautiful.” Severus leaned back. “Do you still care about me?”
“Yes, and I believe that I could fall for you.” Hermione softly smiled at him. “I’m willing to move here, Severus.”
“I love Spain!” Septimus cheered. “I love going to the tapa bars!”
“Septimus!” Severus sneered. “Please be quiet.”
“Yes, Father.” Septimus meekly replied.
“Oh no, I don’t need another Draco.” Hermione groaned. Severus snorted. “Can we go somewhere to talk?”
“Yes.” Severus got up and pulled her into his arms. “But this first.” He crashed his lips onto hers, garnering a moan. “Oof!”
Septimus hugged them both. “YAY!”
Hermione shook her head, chuckling. “Settle down, my darling.” She slipped her arms into their arms, and they walked back to Severus’s country home.

writing_prompt: When Hermione Granger starts her first day at LCorp, a chance encounter with Kara Danvers over spilled drinks leads to an unexpected connection—and perhaps more than just a shared lunch schedule.
story:
Hermione was patiently waiting in line for a cup of tea at Noonan’s in National City. She was heading to LCorp for her first day of work when a woman stumbled with her tray full of drinks. Hermione tried to get out of the way but wasn’t quick enough, so the tray flew out of her hands.
“Shoot, Miss Grant isn’t going to be happy.” The blonde looked down at the mess before looking up at the woman she ran into. “I’m sorry. Did I ruin your shoes?”
Hermione shook her head. “Don’t worry about it.” She walked to the counter to grab some napkins. “Can you refill her drinks and add a black tea, please?”
“Certainly, ma’am.” The girl hurried to get them as she pointed to the mop for Kara.
“What are you doing?” The blonde grabbed a mop to clean up the mess.
“I’ve reordered your drinks and mine as well.” Hermione smiled at her as she stood up from cleaning off her shoes.
“I can’t let you pay for those, miss.” The woman objected as she rinsed the mop to clean some more.
“My name is Hermione.” She held out her hand.
“Oh, and mine is Kara. Kara Danvers.” The woman beamed.
“Yes, you can allow me to pay for those.” Hermione held up her hand. “because I was too close to you to allow you to clear past me.”
Kara searched her brown eyes. “But I should buy you a drink instead.”
She sighed as she took in the piercing blue eyes. “How about this?” She tapped her chin. “I tend to work through my lunches, and I need someone to remind me to eat.”
“Tsk, Hermione.” Kara shook her head. “You sound like Lena Luthor.” She laughed at her surprised look. “She does the same thing.”
“Ah, I knew I liked her for a reason,” Hermione smirked. “I work at LCorp in one of the labs.”
“Splendid. I can bring both of you lunch and make sure that you eat.” The blonde clapped happily.
“You bring Lena lunch?” Hermione arched her brow.
“Yep,” Kara popped the p. “I had noticed that she was working too hard, so I sometimes make sure that she relaxes a bit, even if it’s just a half hour.”
“Good.” Hermione smiled. “I love chicken salad sandwiches or salads of all sorts.”
“Got it.” She tapped her head.
“Here you go, miss and Kara.” The girl interrupted them.
“It’s Hermione.” She smiled at the girl behind the counter as Kara returned the mop to its station. “How much?” They settled the bill as the blonde carefully picked up the drink carrier from the counter. She grabbed her tea, and they went out of the café.
“I’ll see you later, Hermione.” Kara beamed at her.
“Alright, I’m looking forward to it, Kara.” Hermione waved as she walked towards LCorp.
The blonde stared for a moment until she realised that she was going to be late and took off in the opposite direction.
